24296532.review:
Now that I've played the game more extensively, I can make an actual review. This is going to be a long one.

Now, I know that this game is supposed to be a complete overhaul of all the mechanics and elements that made the franchise brilliant. And believe me, it's an overhaul alright. The graphics are nicer, the level design is fucking brilliant compared to the Re;Birth trilogy (which is what I'm comparing it to), and the main characters are even more fleshed out than ever before, which I like. The soundtrack is nice as well; some of these tracks are actually pretty amazing.

That said, there is one major problem with this game. I... didn't have as much fun with it as I did with the Re;Birth series. I'll go through the major issues, which combined, make this game a bit lacklustre, at least to me.

- The first is the difficulty. It fucking slides about like a wet turd on a teflon floor. The first two areas of the game are nice and easy, then the enemies suddenly gain stats that are about three times as high as the ones just before. This is a ridiculous difficulty spike and it really threw me off when I first got to that third area (and I've finished the entire Re;Birth trilogy so I should be pretty good). Unfortunately, this trend continues throughout the game. Some bosses are easy, some are challenging, but then others are downright cheating (I'm looking at you, K-Sha, you multi-turn, million shots per attack shithead). The difficulty of the game flipflops like crazy throughout the whole game and it's not really fun to work around.

- The storyline is not nearly immersive or expansive enough for the story it's trying to tell. Two of the antagonists you see throughout the second part of the game, they're pretty big and important in that bit. Then at the beginning of the third chapter you just defeat them. That's it. THAT'S IT. THEY ARE SOME OF THE BEST AND MOST INTERESTING CHARACTERS AND YOU JUST... DEFEAT THEM. Yeah there's a bit of unnecessary bullshit with the whole 'NEXT' thing, but seriously? The way they portray the whole third chapter, it's like they were never threats at all. This is just one example. Blanc's route during the second chapter is 70% EXPOSITION. The remainder is just bosses and the worst areas in the entire game. There are so many issues with the story that it's barely even worth shitting on, and that's a shame, because it could have been REALLY good.

- After literally more than a dozen games, some of which are spinoffs, you'd think, you'd just THINK, that they'd bother to put more effort into their cutscenes than they do. They're identical to the cutscenes from the old games, which I find is just plain laziness more than anything else. I don't quite understand why these games take over a dozen gigabytes when the cutscenes, which take up about a third of the game in total, are just slighty animated portraits with some facial movement... and text. Just text. Admittedly there is a higher percentage of voice-acting in this one, which is great because I love the voices of the characters. It's just that they're still recycling exactly the same style and sprites for these scenes without any innovation.

- And the bosses. The fucking combat in general is a near-perfect carbon copy of any other Neptunia game, which is REALLY DISAPPOINTING. The only new mechaninc are the giant fights, of which I experienced two of them, and both of which were in the first chapter, and are never brought up again. BOOOOORIIIING. I want at least some innovation, please, is that too much to ask? But I digress. One new mechanic in the boss battles is the multiple health bars thing. BUT IT'S POINTLESS. They only exist to give a false sense of progression through a boss battle, and nothing EVER makes use of them. WHY HAVE THEM AT ALL? Some major bosses also have some quote they'll utter when they hit half health, but nothing else ever happens, so why bother? The difficulty problem also applies - some bosses are piss easy and do barely anything, while others FUCKING NUKE YOUR ASSES OFF THE PLANET. Why have bosses with nukes? That's just cheap. And don't even get me started on K-Sha.

I got the bad ending on the first run, which is good, because if I get the bad one then I like that it's because I didn't fulfil the requirements for the good one. The problem with the  bad ending is that the already short story just... stops. Abruptly, and with the whole 'we're all going to die' vibe. That whole bad end just sums up the game really. It's just that in comparison to the Re;Birth games, this is just a bit on the disappointing side.

That all being said, I still had SOME fun with it, just not as much as the old games. I can still recommend it, especially if you've not played the Re;Birth trilogy, but if you want something better, just get those.

24285767.review:
The latest game in the series improved on graphics, interface, gameplay, and added many new features and updated older features. I see that this game had way more effort put into it, at least for me, than rebirth 2 and even rebirth 3. There is a lot of content here.
There are 3 stories to play through. The characters are great. I have always liked the writing in this series which is one reason I keep coming back to the series.
I also feel like there isn't as much grinding that you have to do like in the earlier games. But having played the other games I ended up going overboard and over leveled.
Note that making in-game money for cosmetic items can be difficult if you want all the costumes and hats but if you don't care about that stuff than its alright.

If you have not played the previous games this game will explain certain characters and events of the previous games as you play.
I also loved the soundtrack in the game. Its still wierd that they don't have a much larger budget for their english voices but atleast the majority of the main quests are voiced.
The game comes with quite a bit of free dlc. The dlc bundles you can buy are not necessary as they are just op weapons and equipment. But the dlc characters are worth it.

Overall I enjoyed the game and am still enjoying and would recommend it to my friends. At least the ones who enjoy anime.

As an avid fan of JRPGs, particularly the Neptunia Series and Visual Novels also having to wait for thsi game's steam release since it's PS4 release more than a year ago, this is the best one yet.

It may not apeal to many people because of how long the dialogues are or how grindy it can get but that's the who point of it being a JRPG. The story is a continuation from HDN Victory/Rebirth 3: V Gen so a must buy for those after the actual story.

Gameplay wise, its been revised to a completely new mechanic while retaining the turn-based elements we have gotten used to. We must not forget the increased fanserive from our girls. The visuals have gotten a lot better considering it is a PS4 game. I have no issues with the game so far.

24276823.review:
作为主机党的我本着对nep的爱又买了一份pc版，终于做为评论者，来给各位-传教~进入正题（我就分剧情，画面，系统，音乐来客观的评价下吧）
 Megadimension Neptunia VII如各位所想的一样是一款偏萌豚向的srpg游戏（看标签就知道了喂）制作商为ch，
1剧情：十分有心且精致          无论是人设，世界观，人物刻画还是故事的展开都可以说下足心思，什么样的世界是被人憧憬的，什么样的人物是被人所喜欢甚至为人所爱的，这些又要怎么体现出来......这些显然都被制作者考虑在内而。       而这作的剧情也制作的十分用心，（跟上边一样，用心就是可以说是该燃的时候让你燃，该吐槽的时候让你吐槽，该感动的时候让你感动）无论是过程还是结局都令人赞叹，长度也有rb1的3倍左右，而且比较让人兴奋的是这作可以说摆脱了rb1那种完全靠卖萌而赚钱的形式，虽然对我来说剧情方面对于我心目中的神作还有差距，但就冲他不用卖萌来坑钱这一点我给10分

2画面：ch：给我足够的机能，我给你一个世界          额，在各各方面ch都很弱，但是这一代的画面实在是让人震惊，（因为和前几代对比相差十万八千米），无论是动作的流畅度，模型的精致度，还是光影的渲染都和前几作不是一个量子级，，，不过这些都与我无关，从前几作开始就可以体现出ch对于场景的想象力都是十分强的，但是psv的机能就不足以表现他们的想法，，，，，这一作是由ps4移植，ch的创造优势便体现出来，实话说有几张地图，比如带樱花的那张着实吸引住了我。（我玩什么孤岛危机3的时候只是不停的爆炸）         不过既然他是移植的就有优化这个问题，我的显卡比较好，所以没什么问题60fps测试全程没怎么掉帧偶尔卡卡可以说是竞技水平的帧率当然（我没在pc通关等以后有心情再5周目买剧情dlc还得重开，，，）但据显卡不怎么样的同学们都说优化渣，这也是一个很大的问题。希望下次能改善             画面我给8.1分   参照（显卡危机3：    8分）（我认为真正触动心灵的画面便是好画面无论是rpgmaker还是虚幻4有点跟不上国内的主流价值观那，，嘿嘿大家自己感觉就好~）

3系统：srpg老家系统相当成熟创新的地方也不少，comdo系统实在吸引人·只要你不买武器dlc就够你研究了               这句话已经把我要说的基本说完了，值得一提的是本作稍微（sang bing)的提高了难度对于rpg萌新来说难度堪比黑魂，，，（也没那么难了哈哈~）srpg中的精品7.8分（参考。守望先锋8.5分在我眼里系统的成熟与创新才是王道守望的问题i还很多那，，，）

4.音乐：棒棒哒~                 无论是游戏的音乐还是限定光碟的音乐都十分棒， 必杀音乐，变身后的音乐让我很是震惊，3篇的op也很好尤其是第3篇的op简直美爆，，，(ch围绕这一ip创造的音乐很多而且都很好有兴趣的可以从音乐网站查找）         音乐我给9.3分（参照gta电台6.8分     这个是自己的事了gta电台音乐本可以拿到很高分但是实在无法与gta本身融合以至于我想听歌还要调电台和萌新都不知道有电台这回事           综上所述我的评分标准可不止有音乐本身哦~  不过本身我也觉的海王星的分要高于gta，，，，）

于是在本人的心里这是一款高分作品比守望先锋还要高，有人一顶会问问什么和守望比因为我打剧情dlc时他们俩一直在争宠，最后nep赢了，，，，好吧还有dlc地狱大家挑dlc时一定要好好看，我推荐睡衣dlc和剧情dlc睡衣一定要买~
       测评就到这里了，希望对大家有用

24266793.review:
This is everything that you expect of a Neptunia product and even more.
It has a great sound track, a great design, meta-breaking comedy, epic fights, and pudding. Lots of nice pudding.
Mainly for gameplay, the battles feel much more engaging and the world feels tons more alive with the route system. The giant battles and the transformation sequences feel satisfying and make you feel powerful as well, which is a massive plus.

I've been a fan of Neptunia since the release of Hyperdimension V and I thought the cast of V was it. It was their best moment and none of the side releases like U or Hyperdevotion Noire could amass to what they've accomplished. But Idea Factory and Compile Hearts delivers to impress on VII with an even BETTER cast and even more characters to love.

Who ever thought that since on release, that the dodgy original Hyperdimension Neptunia series for the PS3 would spawn such a large fanbase with such a niche but smart target audience?

I'm probably just fanwhoring at this point but I do support people buying this game and hope they can have the same enjoyment that I had with it.
Maybe for context, you would want to buy Re;Birth 3 first, but as a standalone, VII can be lovable as well.

NepNep/10

24247499.review:
여러모로 발전한 모습을 보인다.
포메이션 시스템이란 게 생겨 합동 이그제 드라이브와 달리 포메이션 공격으로 강력한 공격을 주는 게 가능해졌다.
변신씬도 전작까지는 그냥 빛 한번 번쩍하고 변신 끝! 이라는 느낌이었지만 이번에는 좀 자세하게 보여준다.
퀘스트도 목표가 있는 던전을 표시해줌으로서 퀘스트 클리어를 위해 어느 던전을 공략해야 하는지 일일히 살펴볼 수고성이 줄어들었다.
무엇보다 영차원,초차원,심차원 3개의 편으로 나눠져 있어 전작들과 달리 큰 볼륨을 보여준다.
특히 초차원편에서는 4여신인 넵튠,느와르,블랑,벨 4명의 스토리를 각각 따로 다루는 세밀함도 보여주었다.
다만 단점도 보이는데 전작과 달리 맵에서 이동을 하려면 루트를 이용해야 한다.
그런데 이 루트라는 게 그냥 있는 것도 아니고 가끔 몬스터가 나오는데 귀찮기 짝이 없다.
왜 멀쩡하게 잘 움직이던 걸 버리고 루트라는 걸 넣었는지 의문이다.
또한 PS4 기반이라 그런지 약간의 버벅거림이 존재한다. 이벤트씬은 문제 없으나 던전의 경우 약간의 버벅거림이 존재하는 걸로 보인다.
그리고 이건 나만 겪는 문제가 아닌 걸로 보이는데 간혹 그래픽 하드웨어 문제로 게임이 강제 종료되는 경우가 있는 듯하다. 단순한 컴 사양에 의한 문제인지 게임 자체의 문제인진 모르겠지만 후자라면 하루 빨리 고쳐지길 바란다.
결론을 말하자면 꽤 게임 같아졌다. 클리어 데이터를 이어서 할 때도 자신이 원하는 것만 이어서 하는 게 가능해졌다.

  《新次元海王星Ⅶ》的画面并没有让人失望，同前几代相比这一代子在许多方面都得到了加强和改善。首先是人物立绘上面，每个人物都会有一个呼吸的动态效果，这对于以视觉小说进行剧情的游戏来说无疑增加了逼真程度。另一方面本作在战斗场景中的画面也有所改善，虽然近看还是一如既往的满是颗粒感，但是无论是人物模型还是背景效果都有大幅度改善提高。画面8分。画质UPUP和一些细节处理比之前好多了。
  超大BOSS的设定十分带感啊~打起来手感也不错。nextfrom变身好评如潮。游戏操作上7分。
  游戏也分了零次元海王星Z，超次元海王星G，心次元海王星H三篇。较之前作品多了许多新元素。但是我突然发现篇章之间钱貌似是不继承的~你这是搞事啊朋友。剧情8分.总算不是单纯卖萌了。
  音效上萌豚福音，うずめ的三种声线好评w。CV阵容依旧屌炸。可惜没我兵库北的iris  heart。P.S。地铁站环境音效绝对是音效的最大败笔没有之一。音效9-2分。背景音乐不错。CV阵容强大。地铁环境扣2分

  游戏性上比起之前的无脑莽增加了【些许】难度。当然DLC逆天还是海王星的一贯特色。
  总的来说。玩了海王星，身体一天比一天虚弱了。不说了、白金预定。接着肝去了。
  
 P.S。对话中听出来了好多梗啊。比如0079阿姆罗的连我爸都没打过我。还有0079夏亚的经典台词。还有NEP每次突入BOSS说的：通往未来的领航员就让我neptune担当.00剧场版Mr.不洗澡的梗。编剧你是多喜欢高达啊。

Самая лучшая игра от IF

Сравнивать с реберфами будет аналогично если сравнивать Небо и Землю

3 Арки с приличной продолжительностью и отличным сюжетом.

Боевка улучшенна до максимума, стало удобно использовать скилы, Exe атаки, кооп атаки. Переделана система комбо его продолжительность зависит от оружия а также скилы теперь нельзя повторять.

Теперь игра не будет давать кучу персонажей заставляя игрока выбирать своих любимцев в первое время вы будите прыгать от одних персонажей к другим позволяя поиграть всеми (под конец все персонажи будут доступны)

Схватки с огромными боссами добавили новую механику в игру

Имеется миниигра - пародия на Спелункера, пытаетесь пройти данж прыгая по платформам избегая ловушек жизни ограничены так что все не так просто.

Очень порадовали новые "Некст формы" играя за них чувствуешь значительную силу

Убрана надоедливая Стелла и добавленны Скауты
Скауты - это огромное количество персонажей которых мы можем отправлять по данжам и они будут приносить деньги, предметы, других скаутов а также открывать новые данжи и врагов. Еще при отправки в ту или иную локацию они дают бонус на нее (аналогично мечам в Fairy fencer F)

Думаю это можно отнести ко всей серии но разные отсылки, даже мелкие и ломание 4 стены делают оч забавной :D

Саунтрек как во всех играх Иффи 10/10

Получить тру концовку не так трудно, а после ее получения как и в 3 реберфе дается полностью открытый мир с тремя измерениями и новыми испытаниями)
Покупайте не думая ^_^

24229529.review:
Really recommend this game. Maybe more than I would Fallout 4, with all the DLCs in mind and even with the replayability factor against it.
Idea Factory has done it. This is the best Neptunia game of all, and the performance of this title on a PC beats the PS4 performance (keep in mind that PS4 doesn't actually run 1080p, it's upscaled 900p). 

There's a caveat however. Slowtown occurs when random battle happens at world screen. There's also memory leak management that needs to be improved.

A controller is highly recommended if you want to play this game. Both Dualshock 4 and Xbox one controller work nicely with it.

*The game may not run to full potential on laptop as it defaults to windowed mode. Manually set profile for Neptunia VII to performance mode solves this issue. 
**Read http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=720156292 if you wish to set the resolution above 1080p. You need a hex editor but it's worth it.

During this time of social unrest, 
deprecating rumors about the CPUs have begun to saturate Gamindustri.

to replace them and that their rule will end.

Their destination: 
a divergent world, nearing its catastrophic end,
called the Zero Dimension. 

They encounter the last remaining CPU of this world, 
Uzume Tennouboshi, who is desperately waging 
a lonely battle against a colossal evil known as the Dark CPU. 

Will Neptune and Nepgear be able to work together 
with Uzume in order to save Zero Dimension from tragedy?
So begins a new adventure for Neptune...

24213638.review:
Here is some pro and cons of Megadimension Neptunia VII. Note that this review is based on PS4 version and I believe that there are no differences between the PC version:

Pro
----
+ Uzume (no seriously - possibly no 1 reason). Her gap moe is something!!!
+ Umio.
+ Adult Neptune and Neptune combi!
+ Megami 2nd form!!
+ Scout system now easier to understand - unlike Victory.
+ Brought back the original Neptunia features - Break obstacles!
+ LARGER DUNGEON!!!
+ EXE drive does not carry over to the next battle (yeah! more challenging!!). No more cheap EXE spam!
+ Enemies has breakable parts! (Now positioning characters makes more sense!).
+ One of the few games that I need to utilise buff skill!!!!! (Kudos, challenge 5 star).
+ G dimension lets you fully utilise each megami individually! No more picking fav yo! (at least in G dimension)
+ More suspense and refined storyline! (Just play until the end)
+ THE BGM!!!
+ Each weapon have fixed preset of Rush, Power and Standard. No more cheap spam attack.
+ Positioning during battle to activate party skill!!! POSITIONING!!!
+ Lily system now does not require mandatory 2 party member to coupling front and back!!! (HELL YEAH!!!)
+++++ Fanservice

Meh
-----
?? HDD drive transformation eats nation shares... I prefer it to be like MK2 where it gradually eats SP overtime instead...
?? Where are the Oracles???
?? Where are Mages?? 5pb?? RED?? Falcom?? Etc.
?? Where are Pururut and Peashy???
?? Still... same old boring dungeon. No innovation...
?? Personally I prefer Stella’s ☆ Dungeon over scout system... faster and easier.
?? EXE skill and SP skill is under one window and not in different command (just personal preference).
?? Battle in Sharing Field felt limited... only allows player to use skill and not normal attack. Game dev should improvise it in the future.
?? Route building felt unnecessary. Instead, why not making the routes as a full explorable map instead of route point?
?? I notice a bit of lagging when compared to PS4 counterpart. I have a quite decent gaming PC rig with Radeon 7970 though...
?? I'm not a fan of the Challenge mode though... too much time wasted.

Cons
-----
- If Megami KO in battle == ate large chunk of nation shares... WAT!!?? THIS IS PUNISHING!!!
- Scout exploration outcome heavily random... detecting hidden treasure waste a lot of time even in NG+ which makes...
- NO HIDDEN TREASURE SCAN ABILITY!!! WHY DID YOU REMOVE THIS??
- ORNAMENTS BECOME ACCESSORIES!!??? WHAT?? (Now only Armors, Idea Chip and weapon give increased stat...) OH PULEEEZZZ!!!

Overall
--------
I still believe MK2 (the PS3 version - not Rebirth:2) battle system is slightly better than the other main Neptunia titles, as MK2 utilising both AP and SP system approriately. However overall, Megadimension Neptunia VII delivers better content as well as gradual improvement over its predecessors. As a Neptunia fan, there are no dissatisfaction in playing this. I give this game a solid, umio out of seaman!!

Should you buy it? Hell yeah!!

期待这个游戏很久了，之前的内测也参加了，终于上Steam马上就入了

本作在各种方面都改进了不少
画面，战斗系统，音乐
故事背景定在次世代主机还没大规模上市，前时代主机市场衰落的时代（Steam崛起的时代笑)
比起愉快欢脱的前三部，本作的故事情节上要沉重不少，这点从开始画面就能看出来。。。

另外本作的音乐制作相当出色，很贴合气氛，不少地方甚至用上了交响乐和人声来烘托气氛，要比RB123公用OST的电子乐高出好几个档次。

DLC能让初期便轻松一点，入不入看自己期望了

24200105.review:
《戰機少女》系列最新作《Megadimension Neptunia VII》正式於今年七月五號從 PS4 主機平台移植至家用電腦平台，此篇評論是以電腦版本為基準且不包含完整 DLC 內容介紹。本作破天荒將遊戲主線劇情分成三大章節，分別是零次元、超次元、心次元，玩家進入遊戲所接觸的第一章節【零次元】訴說著 Sega 家用主機 Dreamcast 之殞落，對手 Playstation 擁有 Dreamcast 所缺乏的 RPG 大作，加上 Sony 於千禧年正式在日本地區販售 Playstation 2 ，給予 Dreamcast 無情的最後一擊， DC 世代正式結束。女主人翁『紺紫之心』涅普迪努和『女神候補生』涅普姬雅不小心誤闖異次元，巧遇掌管零次元的女神『橙色之心』天王星烏茲梅，三人同心協力要擊敗來者不善的黑暗女神，拯救即將消逝的零次元國度。


第二章節【超次元】所講述的故事跟你我息息相關，單機遊戲已經無法滿足消費者需求，手遊課金遊戲迅速發展引起遊戲業界動亂，被黃金之力擊敗的四國度女神失去了人民的信仰，掌控黃金之力的神祕少女 B-Sha、C-Sha、S-Sha、K-Sha 成為遊戲業界新統治者，不過生活在遊戲業界的居民們並不快樂，少數人心中仍存有對四女神的記憶與信仰，故事也將從四女神視角出發，目的是要取得國度統治權。看到這裡，大家是否發現神祕少女們的名字就是在暗喻日本四大手遊大廠：萬代南夢宮、卡普空、史克威爾艾尼克斯、以及惡名昭彰的柯拿米，黃金之力也是暗諷『打不贏嗎？多課一些錢吧！』的課金文化，人們漸漸忘記玩遊戲的初衷，變成手遊大廠眼中的肥羊，誰來支持堅持研發單機遊戲的廠商呢？

超次元章節還另外新增了拓展路線、都市投資、見聞者等全新功能，區域之間的移動是用地雷踩格方式進行，想要進入新地城必須要花費金錢拓展路線；而都市投資項目細分為商業、工業、公民關係三種，商業投資等級提升可以在商店內購買更多種類商品，工業投資等級提升可以研發更多種類道具，公民關係投資等級提升會觸發事件，除了能獲得道具獎勵以外，還有機會讓見聞者加入你的團隊；見聞者功能讓玩家能派出見聞者去地城探索，不僅能使玩家在地城探險時獲得增益效果，每隔一段時間見聞者還會從地城帶回素材喔！


戰鬥系統方面跟前作沒有太大區別，同樣是以連續技為主、技能為輔的作戰風格，透過連段攻擊累積 EXE Drive 氣槽，同時消耗氣槽使出強力必殺技或是獲得女神變身效果，較大的改動是取消了【Break】破防技，取而代之的是部位破壞系統，玩家在戰鬥時破壞怪物特殊部位會使對方防禦下降，同時還有機會獲得額外素材獎勵。順帶一提，當玩家進展到【超次元】章節後期時，更會開啟【女神二段變身】能力，從名稱和外觀來看可以明顯發現，女神們透過二段變身成為次世代主機，除了外觀有明顯改變外，戰力更大幅提升。

遊戲前期難度較高，主要是因為加入隊伍角色過少，補品攜帶數量從 99 降為 30，角色升級也不會自動回滿血量，只能離開地圖回到據點補血，種種設定都讓未購買 DLC 的玩家吃盡苦頭，金錢不足無法取得補品只好先農怪賺錢，要去農怪又發現同等級的怪物血量傷害都偏高，只好回到低等地城苦蹲。還好到了超次元章節後，人物等級提升到三十左右，遊戲整體節奏快了許多，怪物不再硬得跟石頭一樣，頭目雖然還是一樣強大，但不至於會到被三招秒殺的程度，簡單來說本作屬倒吃甘蔗類型的作品，熬過前期後面會輕鬆許多。


為什麼會特別跳過第三章節【心次元】劇情介紹，《Megadimension Neptunia VII》不像是系列前作，主線劇情清楚明瞭跟你說誰就是反派，這次的敵方勢力比較特殊，反派真面目要在故事最後才會顯現出來，太詳細介紹心次元章節會因為劇情透漏影響到遊戲體驗。《戰機少女》系列作一直以來都是粉絲取向，專門以人物設定為主要賣點的日系角色扮演遊戲，先不管遊戲性好壞，光是作中反映真實遊戲業界的史實捏他，就讓熟知遊戲發展史的玩家們激動不已，所以本作是一款值得一試的好遊戲嗎？答案是肯定的。


優點：
+主線劇情分為三大章節，見證 DC 興衰史、課金手遊崛起等史實捏他。
+女神二段變身系統，次世代主機已上市多時，女神當然也要次世代化。
+舊酒不只換新瓶，拓展路線、都市投資、見聞者等全新功能等你體驗。


缺點：
-令人無法直視的海量 DLC 商法，建議大家單獨購買角色擴充包即可。
-遊戲前期難度非常不人性化，可能會造成耐心不足的玩家直接棄坑。


結論：值得用心體會的戰機少女新作，遊玩總時數堪稱是系列作之最。


網誌圖文好讀版：
http://mgrim214.blogspot.tw/2016/07/megadimension-neptunia-vii.html

24198621.review:
谢谢这款游戏
目前我只玩了3小时，发觉BGM，画面什么的变化很大，画风也有一些细节的变化。
对于这3小时的游戏体验，发现游戏在对于新萌点进行了许多探索。
UZUME是有3条不同的声线，每个性格都有许多变化。但是，萌点是在于人物塑造而非反差萌。
另外我认为游戏在开始阶段略微沉重，有时是在刻意卖萌，这点不够出色。

****但我暂时并未深入游戏，现在我对于游戏的了解过少，总体而言
1.游戏有足够的新意和画质提升。
2.场景丰富不少，在对话中的动作以及表情变化非常丰富。
3.优化有点不够给力。
4.暂时评分8.8/10

PS.等了很久的海王星了，总体还是要谢谢这个游戏带来的欢乐。

at first i thought it had something to do with my hardware, but if the second dungeon runs perfectly for me, well I just don't know.

I'm gonna keep playing, hopefully it won't be so buggy here on out, and hopefully i won't hafta revisit that first dungeon.

Since I'm not certain the prollems will remain in that first dungeon, this review will remain negative. Once i've beaten the game, I will change my review to positive as long as this flickering and artifacting stuff doesn't reappear. Because seriosly, that one dungeon is only gonna take like 5 minutes to beat, a five minute hiccup is fine when you get like 40 plus hours of decent gaming. I just kinda wish IF worked a little harder on this port.

24195932.review:
从未坚持玩JRPG这么久，怎么说呢，本人是个没耐心看外语的人，英语简直让我崩溃，而日语更加看不懂了（汉化懒得打）。不过不得说，这游戏虽然花了我至少15-20%时间用于翻译剧情，不过这剧情线给了我不少动力玩下去（Re:birth1/2/3都还没过呢= =)。
  剧情是不错，游戏系统变化也蛮有意思的额，刚开始因为英语折腾不少时间去搞懂，里面的特色连击还是要下不少功夫去研究，不过技能的杀伤效果比我想得强多了。至于EXE系统改进个人觉得没啥实感。
  至于画面，总觉得优化做的还是不够完善，移植了这么多部游戏优化的水平不也应该可以了么- -，为何不再做得更好一些呢。。
  总而言之，这个游戏，绝对是不该错过的。写下这篇测评的我一周目还没过，但在此强烈建议不要开DLC道具，不然挑战性简直变成零，变成割草了（仅个人意见）。想单纯娱乐的话，一周目也可以开DLC人物，反正大多数也要在第二篇章才能得到她们（除了两个人)，不过依旧强烈建议也是不开DLC人物，不然会失去策略性。(你想想2个人的skill和4个人的skill效果，这差距23333)
  好了，该继续去打BOSS了（笑）。

24185955.review:
Lemme just have y'all know that I could have easily just whipped out the PS4 version of Nep VII and simply played the game on that. But no. I bought this game again, along with all it's character DLC, on the PC, just to show Compile Heart and Idea Factory that the Neptunia series is one of the best thing that they have ever created. 

The game itself is pretty good, and serves as a great entry point for newcomers to the series. The only thing you'll be missing for not playing the previous games will be a few random references relating to them. They added a ton of fancy new gameplay elements, but it's still the same Nep formula, so those who have actually played the other Nep games won't feel alienated in the slightest. In fact, almost all of the additions are vast improvements from the other Nep games, making this game probably the best Nep game in the series thus far.

This game is actually crazy complex, so I'm not going to delve too deep into things. If you want to know more about this game, then go read some other review, or actually buy the game. The game comes with tutorials. Read them. Seriously though, it's a good game. Everything you need to know is explained as you play along, from the combat to the storyline. The only noteworthy flaw is that on lower end PCs, don't expect this game to peak at more than 20 FPS at any point. IF and Compile Heart really decided to jack up the graphics, given that this is a PS4 game, and all the previous Nep games were either PS3 or PSVITA games. Seriously though, having a GTX 960 as a reccommended requirement is pretty intense for a JRPG, even if it's a PS4 game. Other than that, the gameplay is solid, and I would recommend this to anyone who is a Nep fan, or really just likes JRPGs in general. The art is drawn by Tsunako, and it looks fantastic The gameplay and story are also both amazing. Also, the guy who voiced Umio also voiced Aizen from Bleach, which I find to be absolutely hilarious and amazing.

24182555.review:
[b]** MINOR SPOILERS! HEAVY SPOILERS ARE COVERED! READ THE SPOILERS AT YOUR OWN RISK  **[/b]

Im memory of my CS knife. RIP

You might've already guess it: Yes, I am a big fan of the HDN franchise. I mean, right now I am having a Green Heart profile picture. But that doesn't mean I always am a blind follower of the decisions IF made about gameplay! I always have to critizise SOMETHING a game is not doing well, or at least not at its best. While it was a..."different" gameplay in HDN 1 (not talking about the Re;births here!) or monotonicity reagrding enemy models/dungeons in Victory, this game was another attendant to be critizisied!...Except I actually don't have to critizise that much which is just...wow.

I need to mention that I have been playing this game a lot on my PS4. 100+ hours

I am structuring my review this way:
[b] 1. Story [/b]
[b] 2. Gameplay [/b]
[b] 3. HDN-worthyness? [/b]
[b] 4. Performance on PC [/b]
[b] 5. Conclusion [/b]

[h1] Story (9.8/10) [/h1]

Our heroine Neptune buzzes off in the park again just to find a mysterious console in a dark, shady alley. And why the heck so ever, the console can talk! After bringing that console to Nepgear, the Nepsters(The Nep-sisters) turn on the console!...just to be sucked into a vortex which leads our dear Nepsters into a different location (Either after progressing through the story just reading the title screen after pressing "new game", you'll know it's the Zerodimension) .
Immediantly afterwards you'll find Uzume Tennouboshi, a VERY important character (telling by the hype or just LOOKING AT THE GOD DAMN SCREENSHOTS OF THE GAME).
So...what actually happened? Why? Can the Nepsters go back to their home? Who is this Uzume? Why is there smoke around her in one of the pics on the storepage? Why am I asking so many questions? And can we get Neptune some god damn pudding please?

All of these questions (well, at least most of them) will be answered while playing the game!
...at least the first chapter.
Yes, you read right: First chapter!
This game offers us a total of 3 chapters which is just magnificent! Each of them plays in different locations which I will be covering briefly ([b] if you dare to read some spoilers [/b])
[spoiler] The first chapter is obviously the Zero dimension: In this one you will mainly find out stuff about Uzume and how the Nepsters are able to get back to the Hyperdimension
The second chapter covers a big scandal in the Hyperdimension: After losing a fight (which you can't win anyways), the whole Hyperdimension changed! Not only a bit, everybody seems to have forgotten who our precious goddesses are!
The third chapter is, what I like to call it, the big f***fest of f***ing your brain because this is where most of your questions are being answered! [/spoiler]

[h1] Gameplay (8.5/10) [/h1]

Remember me saying I critizised the gameplay of the previous games a lot? Well, I did aswell in MDN VII...the thing is that [b] there isn't really much to hate about it [/b].
It is like they took the best aspects of the games and put them into MDN VII while removing the stuff people hated!
Where do I start...the combat system has been kinda revamped: You can only walk in a limited, circle shaped area (MK2). Attacking while fulfilling certain conditions (combo trait) gives the reward of dealing more damage.  Even which attacks you can use is determined by the weapon your character wields. Sword A allows you to have 3 power slots, but only 1 rush and 2 standard while sword B offers 5 rush, but only 1 power and 1 standard slot + no stacking of attacks, [b] TACTIC FOLKS [/b].
Quick explaination:
Rush attacks are attacks with many hits but rather low damage, ideal for filling up the EXE gauge.
Power attacks are strong attacks which aren't good at filling up the EXE gauge but do their job when having to deal a lot of damage with normal attacks.
Standard attacks are a mixture between rush and power.
Skills aren't op anymore and EXE attacks are weaker than in the previous games, meaing they aren't an instant win if your EXE gauge is filled up. But for compansation reasons we get more skills for our characters and the socalled "formation skills". Simply put: Certain formation, same state (HDD or no HDD...that's the question), certain characters, ???, profit!
Coupling skills, lily skills...while it may seem like a small amount of things I listed, trust me: It's A LOT while playing, and I didn't even cover everything!

There are only 3 things I didn't like about MDN VII regarding gameplay:
[list]
 [*] [b]Missing GP.[/b] 
I actually enjoyed the GP system due to the fact that it made me plan when to strike: Since the GP points recharge when depleted, a full frontal attack with every character when the points are depleted was the opportunity to deal massive damage. It made me think to even attack the enemy if he has a few GP points left or to just buff myself and prepare for the later phase of a fight.
Sadly it's not in MDN VII. But well, many people didn't like it so it is reasonable to remove.
 [*] Grinding not really needed.
 I tend to grind a lot. My rule of thumb was "each chapter requires 10 levels" (previous games). Now it's just enough to gain 2-3 levels when the enemies are too difficult.
 [*]Monotonicity regarding enemies.
While expanding the dungeons to be bigger and even using a lot of different looks of the dungeons themselves, one things sadly mostly remained the same: The frequency of seeing the same enemy model with the difference of being reskined/in a different colour. It isn't bothering, it'd just be cool if they'd not look the same.
[/list]

Overall: SOLID gameplay, minor downsides

[h1] HDN-worthyness? (10/10) [/h1]

I will keep this part short: DEFINETLY.
The story just somehow [i] feels [/i] like Hyperdimension yet it doesn't! It's a welcome mix of ideas for the HDN franchise. But otherwise?
Yes, the humour is just...neppy. Neptune's being Nep again, Vert and Blanc when talking about [i] the upper part of the torso [/i], Noire's being Noire, Uzume's being a VERY interesting, creepy, funny person...Talking about the other characters would blast my review.
Play the game yourself. You'll feel like home if you know the HDN-feeling.


[h1] PC-performance (8.5/10) [/h1]

Overall the performance of the game is good. Looks like the PS4 version.

Would be great if I wouldn't have to critizise something: Game kind of has to load a bit when starting to play it (when engaging into a fight after booting the game). I don't mind it but some people might be bothered
Update 4.8.2016:
Tested the game for the frame drops today, no drops (only when "L2-ing"(skipping) fights). Highered the points this section gets.
[h1] Conclusion [/h1]

Magnificent, brilliant game. It really feels like the developers took their time, money and effort to make the game better in almost every possible there is! I really tried to find things that concerned me about the game...but there aren't many. And even the things that bothered me were rather minor.

[h1] 9.4/10 [/h1]

PS: I didn't buy any DLC and I don't intend to buy any. DLCs make the game too easy (imo) and prefering my games to be challenging makes me not buy them.

24174963.review:
I've played this game on the PS4 and I swear you guys this is probably the most refined installment in the Neptunia series. 

The game's completely polished and difficulty is fairly balanced, there will not be any sudden power spike like in the previous entry. As long as you don't cash in on those weapon packs the game will provide you quite a challenge especially during early to mid-phase of the game as you don't have the access to most power-ups and the lack of full roster in your party. 

Soundtracks are top-notch and while they may still have the same soundtrack from the previous games. The new boss battle tracks are great, it will surely pump up your blood during those fight.
I also really recommend checking out the Deluxe pack while you guys are at it

The story has also a more serious and darker tone compared to the other, the game knows when to lay out the joke or when it's really the time to get serious.

And with the addition of new system like Giant Battle, combination attack and part break it makes the game have a more tactical approach. 

But still it could have been more easy in the use of it's meta joke and heavy references to previous installments.

Pros
+ Overall the best game in Neptunia franchise
+ A more detailed 3D models
+ Good story
+ Great music (check out Deluxe pack)
+ Branching story during 2nd arc, not gonna spoil much
+ Zero Dimension arc has the most well-written narrative

Cons
- may have a rare case of FPS drops, but It's probably depends on your specs of course
- minor bugs, not noticeable enough.

24167804.review:
Remember when you bought that game at release on PS4 because "heck i'll be done with it when it eventually releases on PC?"... yeah I remember too...

[b]Since most people already know what they're getting into by checking out a Neptunia game, I'll just focus my review on the things that stand out from previous releases for me...[/b]

The port works quite fine, runs at constant 60fps except for minor stuttering when transitioning scenes in general in my case, not really bothersome since these transitions usually occur with a fade to black or fade to white, eg: in-game to VN mode, or back to game, or when you press the Enter dungeon button you'll notice a slight pause before the game goes to load the level.

The Soundtrack is really good, with all known BGMs from other games and really cool additions ("Encounter of Destiny" so OP).

Regarding the game, it's more Nep! So I have no objections with that, without spoiling the story too much (already beaten it a few times in PS4) I'll say it manages to strike a better balance between comedy and drama than ReBirth 2, it knows exactly when to stop taking itself seriously, that's a good thing.
Giant boss battles are entertaining, though one might say there are few of them, they come at the right moments to make them meaningful.
They also brought back CPU transformation cutscenes, when you activate HDD form, you're treated to a short cutscene of waifu's transformation into CPU, never skipping those, they're so damn cool!

Combat is a bit more streamlined, the basics are there, you have up to 5 hits per turn, but there's no more Guard Break mechanic so the Break attacks are now named "Standard" and fill a middle ground between Power attacks damage and Rush attacks EXE drive fill. Combo length is now affected by the weapon the character is holding, each weapon has a first attack of one fixed type (Rush, Power or Standard) and then it has one or more combo slots in each type of hit (eg: you can have a weapon with 1 fixed Rush slot, and following it 1 more Rush, and in parallel 2 Power and 4 Standard slots).
In addition many attacks have a "combo trait", which gives your next hit additional damage when you fulfil the combo trait condition for it.
Sort of replacing the Guard Break mechanic, you now have some monters which have breakable body parts, these are usually located and can only be attacked from a specific side of the monster (ie: back, left side, right side, etc), this gives a somewhat tactical approach to combat, since breaking parts can help by reducing one monster's defense, as well as negating the use of certain skills on some others, sadly once you start overleveling the dungeon monters by a tiny bit this is no longer really needed, but it's an interesting system to develop further in sequels (yes please give me MOAR NEP)

There are also leveling and lily rank system changes, regarding leveling, only your front row characters will get experience from fights, this can look like downer compared to previous games, rest assured though, again trying to not spoil too much, you'll hardly have a party of more than 4 characters during your first playthrough, and by the time you have a full roster, you can easily create game discs with the Racing idea chip, which allows characters to gain exp when not in the front line (gives the "Learning" ability).
Lily rank has also seen some changes, like exp, lily rank is now increased between all members of the front row once you finish a battle, as opposed to the previous front+back row pair system.
Previous lily rank increasing actions between characters still work though, such as buffing, healing one ally or allies, using items on allies, and also switching the front row character with the back row coupled one will increase lily rank between them.

Last but not least, this is the first Neptunia game I felt like being "harder" than the others, midway through the game you'll notice you are tossed into the world being underleveled for the mobs you have to fight, so it will require some grinding and good use of combo traits, skills and whatnot, it's not something that will take a huge amount of time though, it lasts long enough to make it challenging and not boring, suffice to say, if you got the DLC weapons this does not apply at all to your playthrough.

[b]TL;DR here[/b]
Wasn't expecting to write this wall of text, but I guess you can see I really DO recommend this game, it's a good step forward for the series, although it might not be trying to do a lot of new stuff, it's still refreshing enough to go back Nep'n around Hyperdimension and its companion universes :P

24166941.review:
ATUALIZADA : 20/07/2016

Nep-Nep is back <3

Para mais aventuras dessa vez passando por 3 dimensões diferentes !!

Megadimension Neptunia VII é o mais recente game da série principal da IF e Compile, a versão steam é um port, excelente, da versão PS4.

[h1] PLOT RESUMIDO E SEM SPOILER [/H1]

Neptune um dia encontra um console antigo abandonado em um beco (um Sega Dreamcast), e enquanto Nepgear planejava concertar o aparelho um portal se abre e acaba sugando as cpus de planeptune para a Zero Dimension, onde elas conhecem Uzume Tennouboshi, a CPU Orange Heart, ultima restante do planeta

A história se divide em 3 episodios, mas muito maiores que os anteriores dos re;birth

Acredite o primeiro episódio na Zero Dimension serve apenas como um tutorial de 12 Horas, o que acaba sendo até legal pois o jogo te preparada para várias funcionalidades q foram adcionadas e só aparecem a partir do episódio 2 sem jogar coisas demais na sua cara desde o inicio

[h1] Gameplay e as "novidades" muito bem vindas[/h1]

Muitas coisas que eram costumeiras para quem jogava os games da série Re;Birth na Steam vão ser uma baita novidade aqui, a principal delas é a extinção do remake system e a troca pelo sistema de investimentos. O que siginifica q chega de ficar com 5 listas diferentes de itens, drops de monstros e recompensas em dungeons para ficar verificando se não deixou coisa pra trás.

Pode ser um ponto negativo para alguns mas acaba na minha opinião sendo muito melhor pq vc consegue aproveitar mais da história.

Isso não significa que os planos não existam, pois existem, mas agora eles funcionariam mais como receitas de um Tales of, basta vc comprar no shop os itens necessários e na aba development na cidade, sintetizar oq quer.

A segunda novidade é a "exploração" do World Map, agora você anda pelo mapa com a personagem ao invés de um cursor, funciona de maneira parecida com o que podemos ver em Agarest, o jogo marca uma rota das cidades até a dungeon, e nessa rota alguns pontos de random encounter podem acontecer. 

Um pouco pra frente no jogo você é introduzido ao Route Building. Basicamente vc deve gastar seus créditos para criar as rotas até dungeons ou outros pontos de interesses, normalmente numa média de 100 créditos por ponto da rota. Nos pontos de cidades você possuí os já conhecidos Shop (obviamente para comprar itens, oq mais seria ? , Guild com as quests já conhecidas, o converse onde eventos acontecem, Gallery,  e os novos Investment e Scout.

No Investment, a partir do segundo episódio vc pode investir créditos nas cidades de cada uma das nações (planeptune, lastation, lowee e Leanbox) divididos em 3 seções. Investindo créditos em Commerce o shop da cidade terá seu estoque aumentado com novos itens, em Industry, novos itens e planos podem ser criados e usados e em Public Relations melhora os itens q podem ser adquiridos nas dungeons adjacentes a cidade assim como os Shares, basicamente o que seria o extinto Harvest Shift dos games Re;birth

Investir fortemente em Public Relations na Zero Dimension mais tarde no game pode lhe render um bom farm de créditos com itens q podem ser adquiridos.

O Scout é o novo minigame onde vc manda seus mascotes para encontrar tesouros escondidos nas dungeons já visitadas. 

Os mapas das dungeons em si são muito maiores e mais variados que antes, é perceptivel isso a partir da segunda dungeon do jogo que possuí mais de um caminho até o ponto do seu objetivo, e os inimigos tb receberam novidades, com monstros grandes q enchem a tela.

Nas batalhas, algumas coisas mudaram para melhor e outras se mantiveram iguais :

A melhoria pra melhor vem na parte dos combos, agora eles não dependem mais de pontos para serem atribuídos e sim de slots que a aarma possuí, os golpes que antes serviam para quebrar a guarda dos inimigos agora servem de meio termo entre um power move e os golpes para encher a barra de EXE......

......outro golpe q sofreu mudanças, ao avançar até a segunda dungeon vc ganha sua primeira Formation Skill, elas existem e agora podem ser usadas com mais versatilidade do que antes, ao posicionar sua party cercando o inimigo um triangulo marca que vc pode atacar com as 3 personagens ao mesmo tempo.

E por falar no posicionamento, o raio de movimentação foi alterando para uma barra q se esgota conforme vc anda, mas ela ainda depende do seu stats de mobilidade.

E por fim os stats são elevados da mesma maneira que em Re;birth 3 / Fairy Fencer, onde suas ações em batalha e fora dela aumentam desde se HP até Strenght, a diferença é que vc não precisa mais usar cada vez uma personagem como principal da Party para ganhar certos stats, basta que ela esteja na Main Party.

E outra novidade nas batalhas é as lutas contra as Dark CPUS e outros inimigos enormes, onde as batalhas acontecem numa area especialmente criadas pra elas, vc pode movimentar sua party entre pontos especificos, e dependendo do posicionamento, alguns skills podem ou não serem usadas.

[h1]Som[/h1]

Eu não costumo falar de som de games nas minhas análises, mas aqui preciso dizer que Megadimension Neptunia VII tem uma das melhores OST desse ano no ramo JRPG, principalmente das Boss Battles

[h1]Conclusão [/h1]

Se eu recomendo ?

Completamente, é sem duvida o melhor de todos os Neptunia disponiveis na Steam, e é muito bom ver que a IF e a Compile adotaram de vez a Steam como casa de NepNep e cia, visto que os spinoffs restantes vão ser lançados por aqui tb

[b] Planejo editar essa análise com mais pontos q achar interessante citar conforme for jogando[/b]

Mas ja garanto que vale o preço da promoção de lançamento, e vale em preço integral tb se vc gosta do estilo e da série, não vai se arrepender !!

24155517.review:
[h1] 梦的旅程，心的旅程	[/h1]

[u] 1. 简单的总评 [/u]
V2跟之前的三款正作相比，画质有着明显的提升（因为之前是PS4独占所以画面很棒），保留了传统的玩法（本格的日式回合制rpg）并且战斗系统有着一定的提升，3d的过场动画制作相当精良，音乐非常棒（心次元的开场音乐真的很好听），人设和声优保留了前几作的超高水准。更加难能可贵的是，本作的剧情是四部正作的巅峰，虽然乍一看仍然是毫无营养的萌妹子拯救世界的旅程，不过这一作剧情上可以挖掘的内容实在是太多，也是本篇评测的一个重点，之后会对此进行一定程度的展开。

本作几乎必开二周目，不然剧情都没法收集完整。推荐一周目走NE，二周目走TE（BE在一周目和二周目都可以，达成条件也很简单），并且一周目强烈推荐不开任何DLC游玩，至少请不要开那些付费DLC，因为一周目的战斗（尤其是超次元部分）相当有挑战性，战斗可以很好的作为体验剧情的作料。

[u] 2. PC移植，战斗和养成相关[/u]
评测超长了……这里缩短了。PC优化不大好，没有PS4流畅，请调低画质。连击系统很重要，务必用好。养成跟之前没太大区别，后期练级无趣而且困难且没必要。

[u] 3. 剧情 [/u]  [b] 以下内容涉及严重剧透，请慎重观看[/b]
本作的故事分位3部分，零次元，超次元和心次元。

3.1 零次元-梦的表象
我并不喜欢末日题材的游戏，因为世界是那么的荒凉，末日余生的人们在无尽的挣扎中度日。道德早已消逝，只有生存成为了唯一活下去的动力。勉强挤出的笑容也并没有欢愉的感觉，仿佛仍在向你诉说着过往的苦难。

第一次，海王星系列的剧情让我感觉到不舒服，感觉到不欢乐。面对末世，新主角Uzume孤独的和敌人作战，为了整个世界中早已不存在的人类。她将自己的本性深深的藏起，留下的是坚毅的背影。一段一段残缺的记录也让你早早知道讲述的是谁的过往和苦难，难得的轻松景象也难以让我高兴起来。最终击败黑暗女神也仅仅是整个旅程的开始。

这里有几点值得注意：（1）为什么零次元的怪物基本都是面目可憎？（2）Nepgear似乎在做梦时梦到的那个悲伤的Uzume是谁？（3）为何零次元的怪物伙伴们是超次元的怪物形象？（4）为何Uzume能有“梦想成真”的能力？

一周目的时候我就觉得这次的故事水似乎比以往的都要深，后来证明确实如此（也有可能是我想多了）。

3.2 超次元-梦的素材
超次元部分有四个独立的故事，分别是四位女神在失去信仰之后的冒险。白国和绿国（不过百万氪金王的梗当时笑了好久）的剧情说真的略显无趣，紫国的由于主角光环流程较长，黑国对人物的刻画非常细致（尤其是Noire，很值得一看）。最后一起解决了超次元的危机，与Gold Third的四人和谐共处。

这里仍然提出几个问题：（1）B-sha 为何害怕怪物，而且最后和她成为朋友的那些怪物不偏不倚是零次元中Uzume的怪物伙伴？（2）B-sha和Uzume的女神形态有种莫名的相似感，而且Uzume和B-sha有连携技（Uzume的双人连携技另一个是与Nepgear）；（3）Gold Third中的每个人似乎都能找到Uzume（包括另一个Uzume）的影子。

3.3 心次元-解梦
一切一切苦难的根源是另一个自己，我必须战胜自己，哪怕我只是自己的尘埃。

心次元是游戏的最后一部分，长短取决于玩家走的是哪个结局。BE在心次元的流程相当短，NE稍长，TE最长。在这里游戏的最终boss，有着混沌眸色的Uzume（下称Kurome）正式出现了，之前一切的苦难都是由她造成的，零次元也只是心次元的一小部分，为了回到现在的游戏业界，为了向当年封印她（曾经是紫国的女神，因为梦想力量过于强大，人们不得不将她封印）的人们复仇，Uzume不过是她的分身，也是她一直想抹消的存在。BE是大家失败了，现在的四位女神堕落成了Kurome的玩物，任凭她指挥摧毁了现在的游戏业界；NE是Uzume牺牲了自己，和Kurome同归于尽，游戏业界恢复了和平：TE是Uzume最终消灭了Kurome，在游戏业界重生。

[b] 下面开始纯口胡和脑洞：[/b] 当我喝多了~

是的，上述只是表面的剧情，是游戏告诉你的剧情。在我看来，游戏告诉你的剧情和实际剧情完全不是一回事儿。

首先，Uzume并不是Kurome的分身，她们谁也不是谁的分身，是相互独立的个体，有着同一个本尊--曾经的女神Uzume。因为这本身是梦的世界，一切都显得那么的合理又那么的荒谬，整个故事的进行完全符合弗洛伊德“梦的解析”中的描述，梦是由被压抑的愿望经过改装的实现。Uzume当年被自己心爱的人们封印，心中存在着一半的怨恨，也存在着一半对他们的爱。因此这种爱和恨在梦中分裂成了两个矛盾的个体，但是她们的愿望是一致的：那就是重回游戏业界。所以以此来看，BE和TE对Uzume来说是GE，游戏的NE是她们的BE。

因此，零次元是心次元的一部分这点也是并不正确的，不过这两个次元确实联系在一起，并没有主次之分。有意思的是心次元里的主城名称叫“心之废墟”，并且从心次元的地下城名字也能体会到Kurome那破碎并且无力的心。心次元代表绝望和毁灭，零次元则代表希望和重生。

真结局Uzume复活的部分有点令我毛骨悚然。那平静不带任何感情的台词：“I went ahead and accepted 'My' exsistence” （我继续接受“我”的存在），使我怀疑复活的是不是Kurome。不过剧情关于这块也就点到为止了，因为之前剧情明确让你打一场最终boss战，结果是Uzume击败了Kurome。最后真结局的通关动画讲述了一个完全不同的故事，即使不做脑洞就看看也挺有意思。

所以整个故事就是一个曾经的女神为了回到世界的故事，以TE来看她成功了，通过自己梦境的力量，或者说一切都只是一场梦，一切似乎都不曾发生过。

心次元部分仍然会有几个问题：（1）Umio和草根男孩的故事，为何草根男孩会和Umio如此的相似？（弗洛伊德梦的素材理论，Uzume希望自己被别人保护）（2）回到最初的那个问题，游戏一开始Nepgear看到的那个Uzume是谁？（最根本的愿望想要实现）（3）大nep为何会一开始和Kurome站在一边，即使她已经（大概）知道Kurome想毁灭世界？（梦的素材，Neptune是现在紫国的女神，不论是哪个Uzume都希望现在的女神能和自己并肩战斗）

当然可以提出的问题和游戏中剧情自己的矛盾之处（当然是刻意为之的矛盾）还有很多，显示对应在梦境之中的证据也不胜枚举，当你二周目重新细细的拾起之前的剧情时，会有更多感悟，甚至有点丝丝的恐惧。不过这也是这作剧情最有意思的地方。

梦始梦终，醒来之时，一切虚妄。

愿你在梦的旅程中找到你自己，enjoy this game！

最后结局分歧条件，我相信肯定有其他评测说了，这里就不画蛇添足了。

24152068.review:
edit: typos

V2 shows very positive improvements over its previous titles. If you are looking for more of the same Nepu~Nepu experiences. Go ahead, you will feel right at home.

However, the reason I am giving V2 a Negative is not for the Gameplay, nor its Universe but based on my Preference itself. I am prepared for a massive down-votes by the fans who don't want their favourite title to get some Reds, but if you are interested to hear my reason, continue reading ...

[h1]V2 as the VN[/h1]
[ ★★★★★ ]
I love it, seriously, I have no favourite waifu(s) in this universe. They did a wonderful job by adding settings like BGM fading during characters' dialogues / monologues, and etc. It is just that the current build has some weird tiny stutters during those scenes. 

If you are the type that skip the most or whole VN part, you won't notice this. It is not a major issue, but it becomes quite an annoyance if you are on auto-mode, and listen to everything, staring at characters for the whole dialogue. It is understandable if you are skipping something, but it shouldn't be there during the auto-mode.

[h1]V2 as the JRPG[/h1]
[ ★★★☆☆ ]
About average is the closest thing I can put it. It is a grindy sandbox JRPG. You are farming to level up your stats/skills, upgrade your equipments, kill the bosses, save the world, and your friends. These can be done at your own pace, can be customized to some points. 

However, despite it being improved, imho, it is still more suitable for handheld devices, not something for consoles, or PC. 

Neptunia series have been giving the vibes of pick-up 'n play, stop/save your progress, then put it down. I would love to play this kind of games when I'm outside, especially when I have to spend hour(s) waiting for something, but not when I am at my PC.

[h1]V2 as the VN, and JRPG[/h1]
[ ★★☆☆☆ ]
I don't feel that the grindy sandbox JRPG should be used for games that focus on interactions between characters, and story telling. I am coming to V2 to play as Nepu~Nepu~, in order to see her interacting with her friends throughout the story, not to keep on grinding to see Nepu~Nepu~ getting OP, with plots as the additional stuffs.

I know that there are things that you can use to make it easy, less grindy in order to progress through the story, but imo, that is the negative for me, as it breaks the balances to the point that, the RPG parts become boring, which will turn me off from continuing the story. 

It is not something likes the "I am here for the story" difficulty that you can find in several story centric JRPG tittles. That difficulty is tuned to balance the game so that, the RPG part is still interesting, but easy so that you steadily progress through the story, while, the harder difficulty is also available.

I would love to have the option to REMOVE the RPG part while keeping the VN, and have some choices to choose that affect how the stories go, but that would be in my dream.

Some tittles may benefits more from this combination, but not for Neptunia, imho.

[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
Good VN, and more Nepu~Nepu~ experiences, but still a bad combination with grindy sandbox JRPG for PC title. Recommended getting at better discounted price if you are not the Nepu~Nepu~ Fans. If you are new to the series, you should try previous titles in the series, which is much cheaper, with similar gameplay first.

Let's see...
I'm hopped up on nep so forgive me if this seems disorganized. I'm also very sleepy.
Map design is flawlessly executed. Each dungeon is unique and wonderful.
Every enemy (that can speak) is voiced. 
Combo system is freaking amazing. Better than ever before.
Uzume is a total badass.
Nep is, as usual, adorable.
Bath scene pretty early on.
Second (bettter) bath scene later.
A lot of high quality voiced scenes. 
Badass cutscenes.
Amazing soundtrack. Absolutely wonderful. WILL BE VENUS is a personal favorite.
New exe system is awesome and not OP anymore.
Activating HDD always feels so good. The animations are so good. And if you wanna nep up, you gotta work for your HDD.
Noire is as wonderful as ever.
Uzume has a really nice butt.
Formation skills force you to keep moving during battles. Keeps em faster paced than before, while still requiring some element of strategy.
No 4th wall.
A new kind of battle that I won't spoil, but I'm just gonna say it was PERFECTLY executed. 
Superb story so far.
Histoire knows about the memes. 
They know about Nep x Noire fanart.
"Pictures of CPUs spanking eachother. Gross!" - Noire 2016
Wonderful voicing on the menu. "I'm gonna die. I'm SERIOUSLY GONNA DIEEEEE!!!" - Nep 2016

Final verdict? As a unique kind of reviewer, I rate games based on what kind of game it is and what it tries to be. As a JRPG, I give it a 9.5
Absolutely wonderful. There are a few restrictions in place as part of the story, so I can respect that, but I feel like somethings could have been executed slightly better. There are also some lag issues. But hey, as a port from the PS4, that's to be expected. But over all, a WONDERFUL game.
As a Nep game, an easy 10/10. This is easily the best Neptunia game yet. My play time (as of yet) easily reflects that.

Buy this game. You NEED to buy it if you love Neptunia. If you are just a simple RPG fan, try this game out. You are very likely to fall in love.

And remember. Nep responsibly. I certainly have not. I'm going to bed.

Btw, the DLC is not necessary at all. As with all other Neptunia games, it just makes you super OP and breaks the game. However, if you like cute costumes and don't mind a little fun, you can fork over the extra dough. Up to you.

One other thing I'll mention is that I get frame drops sometimes, even with vsync off. This is mostly during scene transitions, such as CPU transformations. Specs below:
AMD FX-6300
MSI 970A-G43 
GTX770 256-bit 2GB 
DDR3 16GB RAM

Overall, this is a worthy addition to the franchise, and I've loved it so far.

24139151.review:
I HAVE A JOB SO I CANNOT FULLY COMPLETE THIS REVIEW BUT I HAVE A TIP FOR PEOPLE WITH FPS PROBLEMS:

When I booted up the game I was having fps problems in the first dungeon, like 10-15 fps and it wasn't smooth at all. I'm embarrassed to admit it and was suprised to find out the problem was because my computer decided to run the game with my integrated card instead of my GTX 960m. Needless to say I swaped the default around, and would recommend disabling the integrated even and I got a smooth 60 fps on highest settings. Now this might not be your problem, but remember to do things like check drivers, maybe even shut down background programs and use something like MSI afterburner to see where your problems are. The game might have legitamate optimization problems, but I'm getting none of it with that change I mentioned. Make sure everything is right, and if you have lower end specs you might have to suck it up and go low quality, which still doesn't look too bad if I'm being honest.

Ok the boring part out of the way, as I mentioned I want to review this game in full but right now I just want to point out some things I have already been pleased with.

Art: Truly Tsunako's best works are in this game, neps are neppier and it is adorable. I have an artbook from Tsunako already and have gotten a sneak peak at the art already, and it's simply fantastic. Also watching her progression getting better and better as the series has evolved is quite a fun thing to observe.

Music: I have already listened to a few tracks and I really am liking them all so far, the atmosphere in the very early game already feels to be a pretty drastic improvement over previous games.

Neps: The most fucking holy and purest life form, so amazing it cannot be possible in real life and leave your friends (which I don't have anymore) and family dissapointed in your life choices. But that doesn't matter when you have Nepu and friends.

That is all I have so far, but message me if you are having optimization problems. I don't know much at all about anything but maybe I can be of some help.

But for now I leave you with a KANGAROO NO YOU NI!!!

(play it in Japanese if you are reel weeb hours)

24134350.review:
If you played this on the PS4 then you will know that this is a lot better than the other games. The music is fantastic while the story isn't the same old "Go to the end of the dungeon to fight this random villan who has to face like 8 CPU's". 

-Story-

The game is seperated into 3 arcs in different locations. This allows certain characters to get the spotlight for that part of the story. What i loved a lot about Megadimension is that the story isn't as predictable as the other games (Depending on how well you know the series). And that the CPU's are brought down to their weakest state, which gives things a change of pace compared to Re;birth 3. When i was waiting for the PS4 release i was scared that i wouldn't like any of the new characters. And i was wrong because Megadimension holds my favorite villain in the series and 2nd favorite character in the series (Uzume). 

-Combat- 

I love the progression system with the weapons you can get. Because the attack combos are different in this game comapred to the other games. Under an attack there is a certain requirement that has to be fulfilled. If it is fulfilled then the attack will have a 100% chance of doing double damage. What i find most interesting about this system is that even weaker weapons can be stronger then a weapon with more STR or INT, because of the ways that the combos connect up. And now there is a new form called the "Next Form" which can be activated if you already have HDD up. And you gain a new EXE attack where once used brings you back to the human form (But its really powerful so its worth using).

-Music- 

The music is godly and no doubt about it. The music is picked perfectly for the current mood of the game and situation. This can be between boss fights, normal fights, transformations and the zone you are walking around. One of the songs made me even tear up when i first heard it (Katharsis).

-Conclusion-

Yes this is the best Neptunia game out there and is worth a shot. Especially since there is a 40% discount for the first week of release. P.S. I won't be surprised if i receive criticism but i had fun making this review. -

ออกจะฟังดูสิ้นหวังไปสักนิดที่ชายผู้อยู่ในวัยทำงานสูญเวลาในชีวิตของเขาหลายร้อยชั่วโมงหมดไปกับการผจญภัยไปพร้อมกับเหล่าสาวน้อยสุดโมเอ้ในโลกแฟนตาซีที่ถูกสร้างขึ้นเพื่อล้อเลียนอุตสาหกรรมเกม แต่สารภาพตามตรงว่าผมไม่คิดสลดเสียใจกับเวลาที่สูญไปสักนิดและยังคงหมายมั่นเป็นอย่างยิ่งว่าจะสละเวลาอีกเหยียบร้อยชั่วโมงหมดไปกับ Megadimension Neptunia VII อันเป็นภาคใหม่ล่าสุด (ที่ไม่ใช่ภาคแยก) ของ Neptunia Series

//หมายเหตุ: สำหรับผู้ที่เพิ่งจะสอยเกมเวอร์ชั่นบนคอนโซลไปเมื่อต้นปี ตัวเกมเวอร์ชั่นนี้ไม่ได้ต่างกัน หรืออย่างน้อยก็เท่าที่ผมเห็นจนถึงตอนนี้ ถ้าคุณไม่รีบร้อนและอยากที่จะซื้อไว้เพียงเพื่อสะสมหรือเก็บการ์ด รอลดราคาในเทศกาลหน้าก็ยังไม่สายนะ//

ส่วนเหตุผลน่ะเหรอ?

+ Neptunia Series นับได้เป็นหนึ่งใน JRPG ที่มีเอกลักษณ์โดดเด่นที่สุดเกมหนึ่ง เพราะนอกจากคุณจะได้สัมผัสกับองค์ประกอบต่าง ๆ อันเป็นเอกลักษณ์สำคัญของ JRPG อาทิเช่น การบุกตะลุยไปใน Dungeon เพื่อ Grind อย่างบ้าคลั่งแล้ว ตัวเกมยังคงมีระบบต่อสู้ที่เน้นการปล่อย Combo และท่าไม้ตายเข้าถล่มกันอารมณ์เดียวกันกับเกมแนว Hack & Slash อีกด้วย ถ้าคุณชอบเกมแนว JRPG ที่เล่นง่ายฮาง่าย นี่ก็คือหนึ่งในเกมที่คุณควรสอยให้ไว ไม่ควรพลาด (โดยเฉพาะอย่างยิ่งเมื่อมันถูกแปะป้ายลดราคา)

+ เหล่าตัวเอกอันเป็นเหล่าเทพธิดาสุดโมเอ้ที่มีต้นแบบมาจากเครื่องเกมคอนโซลที่เราต่างก็คุ้นเคยกันดี และเนื้อหารวมถึงฉากหลังที่อ้างอิงจากอุตสาหกรรมเกมแต่ถูกปรับให้โมเอ้น่าหยิก (หรือน่าถีบ) ยิ่งกว่าเคย ซึ่งถ้าคุณเป็นชาวเกมเมอร์พันธุ์แท้ผู้เติบโตมากับเกมยุค 90s - 2000s องค์ประกอบต่าง ๆ ที่คุณจะได้พบก็อาจจะทำให้คุณนึกระลึกถึงความหลังเหมือนคนแก่และตกหลุมรักได้ไม่ยาก

+ ถ้าคุณคิดว่า Hypderdimension Neptunia V ยอดเยี่ยมแล้ว มันก็เทียบไม่ได้เลยกับ Megadimension Neptunia VII ทุกสิ่งทุกอย่างที่คุณจะได้พบในเกมถูกปรับให้ดีขึ้นอย่างผิดหูผิดตาในทุก ๆ จุดไม่ว่าจะเป็นการแสดงผลหรือระบบการเล่น Megadimension Neptunia VII ไม่ใช่เพียงแค่เกมที่ดีที่สุดในซีรีย์เท่านั้น แต่นี่ก็คือ JRPG ที่ดีมาก ๆ อีกเกมหนึ่งที่คุณสามารถซื้อหาได้บน Steam ณ ตอนนี้ครับ

+ในส่วนของเนื้อหานั้น Megadimension Neptunia VII จะมีรูปแบบการเล่าเรื่องค่อนข้างต่างออกไปจากภาคก่อน ๆ เพราะตัวเกมนั้นจะแยกย่อยเนื้อหาออกเป็นส่วน ๆ และให้อารมณ์เหมือนกำลังชมซีรีย์ (ตัวเกมจะแบ่งออกเป็น 3 ส่วนคือ Neptunia Z, G และ H จริง ๆ แล้วแต่ละตอนมีชื่อเต็มแต่เพื่อประหยัดเนื้อที่ ผมจึงขออนุญาตใช้ชื่อย่อก็แล้วกัน :P ) ตัวเกมในภาคนี้จึงยาวกว่าภาคก่อน ๆ พอสมควร อีกทั้งยังมีเนื้อหาหนักกว่าเล็กน้อยด้วย (แต่ไม่ถึงกับชวนสลดหรือจิตตก) เพื่อไม่ให้เป็นการ Spoil ผมจึงบอกได้แต่เพียงว่าคุณจะได้ออกผจญภัยในมิติที่คุณไม่คุ้นเคยและได้พบเจอตัวละครใหม่ ๆ ที่คุณไม่เคยพบอีกด้วย นี่เองก็คือที่มาของ "Megadimension" ครับ

+ ตัวเกมถือได้ว่าพอร์ตมาได้เสถียรกว่าเกมภาคก่อน ๆ มาก แต่ออกจะกินแรงเครื่องสักนิดเพราะแรกเริ่มเดิมทีตัวเกมนั้นก็มีที่มาจาก PS4 กระนั้นถ้าคุณมีเครื่องกลางเก่ากลางใหม่ คุณก็สามารถที่จะรันเกมนี้ได้ค่อนข้างชิว (เครื่องเบาสุดที่ผมได้ลองกับเกมคือ i5-2400, Ram 8 GB และ GTX 750 ti ก็ยังรันเกมนี้ได้ที่ 1600 x 900 แต่อาจต้องปรับ Option นิดหน่อยให้ลื่น)

สรุปแล้ว Megadimension Neptunia VII ทำให้ผมรู้สึกประทับใจเป็นอย่างมากและเหล่าแฟนบอยควรเช่าหาไว้บูชาโดยไว แม้ตัวเกมจะราคาแรงกว่าภาคก่อนหน้าแต่ก็คุ้มค่าทุกบาททุกสตางค์อย่างแน่นอนครับ

24133435.review:
I'm not far into the game but already the game is showing to be vastly superior to the others in every way. 

Dungeons are larger and more elaborate, things move along faster and combat appears to be more complex, there's new characters, more in game rendered animations, the general dialogue events are better as well with more characters on screen and more animated in general. 

As I said with the dungeons, I arrived at the second one and the areas are much larger and have more paths and aren't as bare bones as previous games, meaning there might be more gameplay vs dialogue dumps this time around. Combat has more depth to it, where positioning your characters can enable special moves and it seems harder to spam stuff like in previous titles as much. 

Gadzooks, there's NEW stuff in the game, new music, sound effects are new and more UMPHY, animations are better looking from what I can tell. New portraits, new moves, new AREAS and they don't look like N64 levels anymore, new battle type! 

It kinda feels like they jammed Neptune into Fairy Fencer, down to the victory poses at the end and level up poses. 

The DLC is .... well if you like being broken over powered then go for it, otherwise all the equipment is too strong, nor can you sell it. You can however disable it or just not use it. 


At the time of writing: 
There are issues with the game, the depth of field option seems to bring even my GTX970 down to 45~FPS, turn it off and you'll have a solid 60. There's some audio balance problems as well, the second dungeon has this weird construction or industurial sound that is incredibly loud and I had to lower the SFX setting. I also had to edit my general control settings as it mapped my trigger buttons to R/L on the dpad which conflicted with the dpad controls in general. 

IF is obviously going to fix this as they've been pretty good with previous games with updating them to fix most issues (except the world map theme from Rebirth 2 which is still way too loud, but there's a mod for that so ...there's that)

24133044.review:
10/10 METAL NEPTUNIA OPENING, HAS BECOME REBUILD OF ATTACK ON NEPUNEPU, WOULD ROCK OUT AGAIN.
Edit: OKAY THAT WAS WRITTEN AS A JOKE AFTER WATCHING THE OPS BUT LET ME STRESS THAT IF YOU WANT A TL;DR, THAT IS ALL YOU NEED TO READ IF YOU GET THE REFERENCES.

Okay, serious review. I've played only up to the first boss since I bought it yesterday and I have to say that I already recommend it. Let's go over a few things.

Graphics: 7-9/10
I dunno if the engine or the way the game is rendered has changed, but I seem to have trouble running it without being on the lowest settings on my laptop smoothly when on the battle map. However, I was able to run Victory/V-Generation perfectly fine without any problems. The game still looks beautiful though. +1 for new Histy story sprite. Seems to be a mixture of map details + enemies, some maps I can run smoothly, some maps I can't.

Music: OMGWTFAWESOME-13/10
Had me from the OP. Background music seemed to be something they really revamped and caught my attention much more easily. A few nostalgic tracks are in there, but YES, it's good.

Story: Can't rate yet, but from what I've played so far, already gripped me and not just for NepuNepu's adventurers.

Edit: STORY IS 10/10, characters you think about make an appearance and also the underlying mystery present in the game along with some of the early twists captivated me and even though I'm hardly past the first major boss battle, I find myself wanting to discover more. An amusing and well-put cast already, looking forward to advancing through the game.

Battle Mechanics/Gameplay: 
Standard world map in battle zones. New world map is a little rough to get used to, but I feel like I'll adapt to it right away. As for battle mechanics, I LOVE the overhaul. No more is it just "pick your most powerful attack/attack that eats up most CP and spam". Attacks now boost other attacks based on what came before them, so you can strategize about what moves to place and where. The new EXE gauge attacks aren't nearly as exploitable plus battlefield positioning because much more important.

NepuNepu: MAX/10
It has NepuNepu. GO GET IT IF YOU LOVE NEPUNEPU D:

玩了一下午，先来评测下。
这一次终于首发直接出了全DLC的捆绑包，而且首发折扣还算不错，先给个好评。
游戏中优化有些问题，场景切换和3D场景战斗时，偶尔会出现卡顿，不过并不是极为严重，总体来说玩起来还是很流畅的。
由于这一代是新出的，所以借鉴了一些海王星U中的ACT游戏元素和一些海王星Noire战略版中的SLG游戏元素，而且3D角色的制作和3D场景的渲染，比起海王星1，2要进步不少。
总之，推荐购买全DLC捆绑包，不仅有好看的装扮，还有新的队友，而且DLC中的装备道具也会帮乃使得游戏初期战斗困难下降不少。

推荐大家，如果喜欢这游戏，就入全DLC捆绑包吧，如果最近不打算肝通关，甚至二三周目的话，可以考虑就入41%off的本体，100那个包里带的DLC主要是电子画册、原声音乐集、主题曲和一些壁纸等等:vanilla3:，游戏内容和本体一样的。
下载下来以后，可以在Steam浏览该游戏本地文件夹，在游戏安装目录下有个DeluxeSet的文件夹，Digital Deluxe版本的额外内容都在里面了。

24129270.review:
i7 4720hq
32gb RAM
GTX 980m

    It's almost amazing how they always come up with new mechanics in their gameplay in every sequel unlike other rpgs which usually make little or no changes to the gameplay in sequels. The story is enjoyable, lovable characters and fresh new experience.

    However, the PC port still faces certain problems such as screen tearing in fullscreen (should be fine in borderless and windowed), random fps drops to 20 (for me) and vertical sync function not working as intended. (I turned it off but it still locked at 60 fps).

    One thing to note about this installment is that the story is a lot more meaningful and deep than the previous series so I found that rather surprising but very refreshing as an experience as well.

    In conclusion I highly recommend those who love rpgs to buy this game as I really believe it will be worth the content it presents. (Though it would be great if they fixed the issues asap).

24129251.review:
I already own the game on PS4 but I would easily recommend this game if you're a Neptunia fan.

This is easily one of the better PC ports of a Nep game I've seen and hasn't given me any grief so far. It seems fairly stable and despite the frame drops reported (which may be due to the particle effects) it runs relatively well provided you meet the minimum specs.

The game started as three smaller games before being put together to make V-2. It seems to work as a cohesive unit and for that it deserves some credit. The way the game feels isn't like any of the Felistella Re;Birth games, it feels more immersive. I'm guessing Galapagos RPG gave a hand somewhere.

I completed the game in around 108 hours. There is more to do afterwards like obtaining items made through development or making use of DLC.

As I said above, I would recommend this to those who are already Nep fans. Those who aren't already may not feel at home if playing for the first time and the odd shower scene may put some off.
Also right now the battle victory theme plays with a ridiculous amount of gain and the distortion can be heard as it plays. I'm sure it will be fixed in a later update.

Overall, for a game which retails for £30 (£18 for this week only), it's very much worth the investment. The deluxe content is also a nice addition if you're interested in its extra assets.

又爱又恨地雷社，几个月前因为实在等不及新次元V2买了PS4，现在终于在steam上上架了，买一份收藏。

+相对前作多样化的游戏机制
+高清以及画质的部分提升
+更加丰富的剧情和愈加与时俱进的玩梗
+人物模型和立绘重制，感受つなこ妈妈的爱吧
+充满槽点和萌点的新人物

-后期体验略微乏力（各种心之迷宫）
-虽然设定和神次元（rebirth3）衔接，但是神次元的角色几乎没有登场

9/10    

对于信徒们来说新次元V2无论如何都是一部令人兴奋的作品，作为次世代平台上的作品在各种方面做出了明显的提升，但是地雷社的表现还有许多欠缺。

steam版出现的问题
-没有官方中文，理论上官中版权属于索尼，因此上架可能性不大
-渣优化，渣优化，渣优化。
-渣优化的基础上画质还略微缩水。

（以下轻微剧透）

tips：
1.常识性问题，本作的Ⅶ不是罗马数字7，而是字母V和一个数字2，进游戏在菜单主页的语音就能听出来。请各位安利时注意。
2.不要被预览图蒙骗了，新次元篇boss建议不要用四女神去打。这boss的护甲用物攻打会打疯，本作四女神都是物攻为主，在剧情高潮处的这个boss设计相当影响体验，建议预先准备罗姆和兰姆作为后卫上来用魔攻解决这个boss。（如果pc版没有变动的话）
3.心次元篇对抗四女神是一周目的难点，请预先练级。
4.对于追求全成就的玩家，steam成就和PS4奖杯是对应的，参考主机版的白金攻略即可。在二周目开始时即可开始准备达成全成就。

24126003.review:
[POTENTIAL SPOILERS AHEAD]



Once again, Compile Heart delivers a fantastic gem that touches your heart and makes you smile and laugh the whole way through. Seriously, i've been hooked since picking up Re;Birth1 and have since looked forward to [b]every[/b] upcoming title impatiently, especially this one as of late. I didn't blink nor think twice when shelling out the $60 for the Digital Deluxe Edition of this game on Day One; I knew this game wouldn't disappoint. And I was oh-so right, moreso than I had anticipated.

Megadimension Neptunia VII takes what the first 3 main series games did to the NEXT Level. Performance improvements, mechanical changes, and a huge assortment of new content makes this the [b]best[/b] Hyperdimension Neptunia game yet. The story of this gem was spawned from three originally separate titles which were all pulled together and turned into one grand adventure, spanning three whole dimensions' worth of dungeons and monsters galore. Speaking of the dungeons, there are a plethora of new types to mesh with the collection of dungeons we all know and love from the previous games. Fight your way through a huge arcade filled with all kinds of games littered about or take a trip through the "Mushroom Kingdom" of Lowee, complete with grassy plains and blocks Neppin' everywhere! Activate your HDD form and dominate everything in your path--although this time, this isn't even your final form! Give it your all and go even further beyond...

As with the previous titles, you're free to customize all of your party members with loads of options! Have your entire team wearing forever-panicked face masks, or go for an all-swimsuit party in the middle of a subway because...well, why not? It's a JRPG, these kinds of things happen. Each HDD form can be fine-tuned as well, allowing the player to optimize toward an element of one's choice, gain an even spread of stat boosts, or choose your parts strategically for brute offenses or impenetrable defenses. Or just mix and match to obtain your favorite HDD design and go with that--there's no wrong answer. The Hyperdimension Neptunia series is generous in giving players freedom of choice in how to play.

Apparently, the English translation isn't quite a direct translation from the original Japanese script, but i've yet to encounter any instances of the English script that I found to be distasteful or otherwise not good. The English script and voices just seem very natural that I would never want to change them. In fact, I personally find each voice to fit very well with the characters they belong to. A highlight example of this would be the protagonist of protagonists herself, Neptune. The voice is carefree and excited--just what you would expect from her goofball-ish, witty nature. But again, this is my personal opinion.

Anyhow, if you haven't already experienced this masterful JRPG series about Neptune and her fellow CPUs of Gamindustri--and if you loved that pun I just made plus want a game filled with lovable characters and that's jam-packed with more references than you can shake your pudding spoon at...what are you waiting for? Hesitate no longer. Treat yourself to the zany adventure that started it all: [b]Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;Birth1[/b], and find yourself engrossed in a fantastic tale of revelation, friendship, and pudding. Lots and lots of pudding.

24125667.review:
Much like the actual video game industry which it so closely parodies, the CPUs within the world of Gamindustri never get a break. Every day, these guardians (mostly) work tirelessly in order to ensure that the people of their nations stay happy and safe and that their lands remain prosperous as a whole. Unfortunately, that isn’t quite as easy as it seems; whether it be the physical embodiment of sin attacking the world, or gross rumors on the Neptunia equivalent of 4-Chan, someone, or something, is always causing trouble. You’d think that, after everything that Gamindustri’s girls have faced, there would be ready for just about anything at any time. Then again, what would be the point of another Neptunia game if everything were that easy? Compile Heart’s newest installation in the series, Megadimension Neptunia VII has the CPUs facing off against an opponent that spans not just all four of their nations, but multiple realities this time around. Will they have what it takes to stand up to this new threat? And, perhaps more importantly, is their adventure fun? Let’s find out!

Megadimension Neptunia VII‘s story starts off with Gamindustri, the world in which most of the Neptunia series takes place, in the midst of what could best be described as political turmoil. Though Gamindustri’s four resident CPUs, goddesses in charge of watching over each of the world’s four major nations, are generally quite loved by the public, there comes a seasonal period of public unrest known as the “CPU Shift Period”. During this time, without fail, every nation begins to become unhappy with the CPU that oversees their nation. Nasty rumors begin spreading, morale drops, and people begin calling for a new leader to step up to the plate. While the CPU Shift Period is a problem that can be overcome (until it pops back up again later, of course), it requires quite a bit of time and effort on the part of both the CPUs and those working to keep the peace within each nation. Naturally, all of the CPUs are hard at work in order to both keep the public safe and happy, and to avoid being booted out of their own nation… well, all except Neptunia‘s main protagonist Neptune. While she should be doing her best to keep civil unrest down to a minimum, good old Neptune has been slacking off as always, leaving her sister Nepgear with all of the work. Though the situation started out looking less-than-promising, things go from bad to worse when Neptune one day brings home an old, mysterious-looking game console (inspired by the Sega Dreamcast) and excitedly begins demanding that her sister fix it (which, of course, she does without much hesitation). Nepgear manages to fix the console without much issue, but things are never that easy; upon booting up, the console immediately begins emitting a strange energy and transports the two to a different dimension. Though the protagonists of the Neptunia series aren’t unfamiliar with hopping dimensions, they weren’t quite prepared for their newest destination; a sinister version of their beloved Gamindustri known as the Zero Dimension that had been completely transformed into a post-apocalyptic wasteland. Though initially wanting nothing more than to escape, Neptune and Nepgear would soon find themselves locked in battle against the threats of the Zero Dimension; threats that would chase them all the way back to their own dimension.

Megadimension Neptunia VII‘s overall tone and progression matches those within previous installments of the series, and is very much a story-driven JRPG. The actual gameplay once again takes place through the form of standard dungeon-crawling, with players trekking through a generous number of dungeons while battling hordes of monsters and collecting treasures along the way in an attempt to get to the end in order to fight whatever boss character may be waiting. The dungeons themselves are well-designed overall and VII does a nice job of featuring different types of dungeon themes in order to make sure that things don’t become stale while exploring. Exploration is really only half of the dungeon-crawling experience, though. After all, you can’t have a good dungeon-crawling session without combat that is both plentiful and fun. Fortunately,   The combat within VII is very similar to that of Hyperdimension Neptunia Victory, featuring a battle system that not only emphasizes traits of combo-centric traditional turn-based combat, but both character positioning and movement as well, meaning that characters are not only able to perform actions such as attacking or using items during their turn, but move around the field as well. Standard attacks, special moves, and items all have ranges, with some having additional features such as being able to attack all enemies within a certain proximity, so an extra layer of strategy is needed when considering how to engage the enemy. 

http://www.heypoorplayer.com/2016/07/05/megadimension-neptunia-vii-review/

24125563.review:
If you want an overview of the game as a whole, check out other reviews that have gotten further into the game or those who have played it previously on the PS4. This review is a first impression when compared to the previous three games.

Here is a basic rundown of things that caught my attention early on that felt very different from the previous games:

1. Comboing is less about spam and skills feel more unique. You can now only have ONE combo attack type (ex. Mega D-Drive) in the power row and no more than once. This means you won't have the same attack down the entire power row and will have to fill it in with other skills. This rule is also for the rush tree (which now ONLY builds up EXE. No more SP gains) and the new standard tree (mix of both power and rush) that replaces the ol' break tree since enemies no longer have a guard bar. Weapons will also determine what combo slots you have open and you no longer have a limit on skill cost since that's been done away with. 

2. Enemies have 'parts' now. Depending on where you attack from or what attacks you use, you may damage parts of the enemy. When those parts are destroyed the enemy's attacks and/or defense will change thus making combat more interactive.

3. The game is now challanging (Without DLC weapons/items). Enemies and you are both pretty fragile so this means you'll need to land those symbol attacks for a strong start. I find myself burning through items unlike the previous games. You might be tempted to use skills to end fights quickly and to avoid losing too much HP, but make sure you don't lose all your SP when you need it most! Reminds me of the Black Heart fight in Re;birth 1 where I had to actually think about what I was doing, while the rest of the game was brainless.

These are things I noticed right off the bat after playing the previous three games and I felt like sharing these discoveries with those who have played the other games and are wondering what sort of differences there are between this and the old games. This doesn't even cover formation skills, completely new areas and monsters instead of recycled content, and an amazing soundtrack of new songs and previous ones.

24125335.review:
Even more polished and refined than Victory. The dialogue and gameplay are as fun as the other main series games, so if you liked those you'll like this one too. Runs great too, no frame drops at all compared to the previous games; they've gotten a lot better at optimizing these for PC. 

I'll list the main differences below.

COMBO SYSTEM:
1) "Break" combo hits and the break system aren't there anymore. Instead now you have "standard" combos which are a mix between rush and power.
2) Your combo slots and starting hit vary depending on the weapon you have equipped. You can't equip two of the same combo move anymore;
3) Combo attacks now guarantee a crit if you meet their combo condition.

MAP EXPLORING:
1) There are breakable objects in the map, though as of my 3 hour playthrough I have not yet unlocked what I need to break them.
2) Hidden treasures are back, though it looks like there's only a set number per dungeon and they don't regenerate anymore.
3) The world map has this sorta Super Mario 3 thing going on where you travel in between nodes. Random chance of encountering an enemy too.

COUPLING/LILY:
1) Front and back battle setup is the same, though now coupled characters can share 10% of either their offensive or defensive stats with their partner.
2) In the options, you can enable notifications for when a lily rank goes up (very useful as you would always have to manually check in the previous games)

Negatives (all pretty minor):

1) Game's still frame locked at 60fps (an issue for some)
2) The giant battles are a bit disorienting due to their scale
3) Traveling on the world map is a bit slow, even with the speed up button held down
4) A lot of the maps will sometimes have graphical flickering. Some more than others, it gets annoying.
5) Seems like only front line fighters get xp now, as opposed to everyone getting xp in previous games.

Note: I'll edit the review to add anything else I find later, as I've only played 3 hours so far.
